title: Israeli airstrike kills dozens of Palestinians in school turned shelter
message:
Israel has claimed it hit a Hamas command centre (Picture: Getty)Palestinian health authorities say an Israeli airstrike hit a school-turned-shelter in Gaza City on Saturday morning, killing more than 60 people.
The Health Ministry’s Ambulance and Emergency service said the strike on the Tabeen school in central Gaza City also wounded 47.
The Israeli military acknowledged the strike, claiming it hit a Hamas command centre within the school, but did not provide evidence.
It is the latest Israeli strike on a school housing displaced people in Gaza since the Israel-Hamas war started some 10 months ago.
The strike hit without warning in the early morning before sunrise as people were praying at a mosque inside the school, according to Abu Anas, a witness who worked to rescue people.

title: An Israeli airstrike on a Gaza school kills over 60 people , Palestinian health officials say
message:
An Israeli airstrike on a Gaza school kills at least 80 people, Palestinian health officials sayDEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — An Israeli airstrike hit a school-turned-shelter in Gaza City early Saturday, killing at least 80 people, Palestinian health authorities said, in one of the deadliest strikes in the 10-month-old war between Israel and Hamas.
The strike on the Tabeen school in central Gaza City also wounded 47 people, the Health Ministry said.
In June, an Israeli strike on a school sheltering displaced Palestinians in central Gaza killed at least 33 people, including 12 women and children, according to local health officials.
On Thursday Israel’s military hit two schools sheltering displaced people in eastern Gaza City, killing at least 15 people, according to hospital officials.
Israel said the targeted school was located next to a mosque serving as a shelter for Gaza City residents.

title: Hezbollah growing drone power | News , Sports , Jobs
message:
BEIRUT (AP) — Lebanon’s militant Hezbollah group launched one of its deepest strikes into Israel in mid-May, using an explosive drone that scored a direct hit on one of Israel’s most significant air force surveillance systems.
While Israel has built air defense systems, including the Iron Dome and David’s Sling to guard against Hezbollah’s rocket and missile arsenal, there has been less focus on the drone threat.
On Tuesday, a Hezbollah drone attack on an Israeli army base near the northern city of Nahariya wounded six people.
In 2013, a senior Hezbollah operative, Hassan Lakkis, considered one of its drone masterminds, was shot dead south of Beirut.
More recent strikes in Syria attributed to Israel killed Iranian and Hezbollah drone experts, including an official with the Iranian paramilitary Revolutionary Guard’s aerospace division.

message:

The attack took place at Rumalyn Landing Zone, which hosts U.S. troops along with those from the U.S.-led coalition.

title: Houthi Leader Concedes Hamas Chief Death Was a  Big Los that  Greatly Impacted  Middle East
message:
The leader of the Ansarullah Yemeni terrorist organization, Abdul-Malik al-Houthi, lamented the “big loss” of Hamas “political” chief Ismail Haniyeh on Thursday, vowing revenge after his departure “greatly impacted” the Middle East.
“The Zionist regime’s crime of assassinating Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh and Hezbollah commander Fuad Shukr has greatly impacted the region’s state of affairs,” al-Houthi said, according to the Iranian state outlet PressTV.
Al-Houthi described Haniyeh’s death as a “big loss” but congratulated associated jihadist leaders for allegedly uniting in the face of his departure.
“The horrendous assassination of Haniyeh was met with the absolute cohesion of the Hamas resistance movement,” the Houthi leader claimed.
All-Houthi’s remarks were more categorical in calling Haniyeh’s death a loss — and thus a net positive for Israel and its allies — than the Biden administration’s.

Initial reports do not indicate there were any injuries in the attack, but the official said that medical evaluations and a damage assessment following the attack were ongoing.
ET, there was an attack using a one-way attack uncrewed aerial system (OWAUAS) against U.S. and Coalition forces at Rumalyn Landing Zone in Syria," said the defense official.
The attack is the latest indication that Iranian-backed militia groups in Iraq and Syria may have resumed attack on bases in both countries following a monthslong pause.
The Pentagon has blamed that attack on Iranian-backed militia groups but has not determined specifically which group is responsible.

title: US announces $125M military aid package for Ukraine
message:
The United States announced on Friday that it would be sending a $125 million military aid package that includes Stinger missiles and anti-armor systems to Ukraine following multiple civilian deaths from a fresh Russian attack.

title: Israel Urban Warfare Tactics in Gaza Offer Lessons for NATO Armies
message:
Urban warfare in Gaza has revealed a painful truth for NATO: Many of its armies are ill-prepared for fighting in crowded cities.

title: Ukraine foray into Russia border region embarrasses Putin . How will it affect the course of war ?
message:
A swift Ukrainian incursion into Russia’s Kursk region marks the largest such cross-border raid by Kyiv’s forces in the nearly 2½-year war, exposing Russia’s vulnerabilities and dealing a painful blow to the KremlinUkraine’s foray into Russia’s border region embarrasses Putin.
The surprise foray has prompted thousands of civilians to flee the region as the Russian military struggles to repel the attack.
The Russian units along the frontier consisted mostly of poorly trained conscript soldiers, who were easily overcome by elite Ukrainian units.
At least one Russian helicopter was downed and another one was damaged by the advancing Ukrainian forces, according to Russian military bloggers.
Russia has declared a federal emergency in the Kursk region, giving local authorities more powers to quickly coordinate an emergency response.

title: Turkey unveils MIR naval surface drone for fighting submarines
message:
ANKARA — The Turkish government’s defense industrial-policy office, the Defense Industries Presidency SSB, has unveiled the MIR, an unmanned naval vehicle designed to fight submarines from the surface.
Ismail Demir, head of SSB, told the press that the MIR will come in three features.
The MIR will have electronic-warfare capabilities, sonar and a range of missiles developed by Turkey’s state-controlled missile maker Roketsan.
“The MIR will enter the military’s inventory as soon as its advanced sonar has been integrated into the system,” Demir said.
The naval drone was developed by a partnership of military electronics specialist Aselsan, Turkey’s biggest defense firm, and Sefine, a privately owned shipyard.

title: Tim Walz Backtracks :  Misspoke  About Using Weapons  In War
message:
Kamala Harris and Tim Walz’s campaign has walked back a statement that the Minnesota governor made in 2018, in which he claimed to have carried guns “in war” during a speech in support of gun control measures.
“We can make sure that those weapons of war, that I carried in war, is the only place where those weapons are at,” Walz said in the recently unearthed clip, according to NBC.
In 2003, Walz deployed to Italy in support of Operation Enduring Freedom, the official name for the war in Afghanistan—but never saw combat or set foot in the Middle East.
“In making the case for why weapons of war should never be on our streets or in our classrooms, the Governor misspoke,” Harris spokesperson Ammar Moussa told the Washington Post in a statement Friday.
The Harris campaign earlier this week also quietly edited Walz’s rank on the campaign website—from “retired command sergeant major” to “retired sergeant major,” according to the Washington Post.

title: Warhammer 40 , 000 : Space Marine 2 Showcases Sniper and Tactical Classes
message:
With Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2 edging closer to its release a month from now, developer Saber Interactive and publisher Focus Entertainment are continuing to offer new glimpses at the brutal action the shooter will have in store, and with a newly released video, they’ve showcased its multiplayer offerings a little bit more.
Specifically, a new look at the game focuses on two of the long-range character classes that players will be able to play as in Space Marine 2’s multiplayer modes– the co-op mode Operations and the PvP mode Eternal War.
Then there’s Sipius, the Sniper class who benefits from swift and nimble movement, as well as his Camo Cloak ability, which lets you turn temporarily turn invisible to sneak up on enemies and catch them unawares.
Check out the gameplay below for a loot at both classes in action.
Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2 launches for PS5, Xbox Series X/S, and PC on September 9, with post-launch details arriving in the coming days.

title: HMAS Sydney fires SM - 6 - Australian Defence Magazine
message:
HMAS Sydney has successful fired a Standard Missile 6 (SM-6) off Hawaii inside the US Pacific Missile Range as part of Exercise Pacific Dragon - a multilateral ballistic missile defence (BMD) exercise led by the US Navy.
SM-6 is an extended range air-defence missile that can also perform terminal phase BMD and anti-surface warfare missions.
"HMAS Sydney’s first-of-class firings of both Naval Strike Missile and Standard Missile 6 in less than a month demonstrates Navy's ability to deliver on governments direction in support of the strategy of denial.
Standard Missile 6 is an extended range-air defence weapon that complements the Standard Missile 2 weapon already in the Royal Australian Navy inventory," the Chief of Navy, Vice Admiral Mark Hammond said.
SM-6 will be progressively deployed across the Royal Australian Navy’s three Hobart class destroyers and, in the future, the six Hunter class frigates.

title: Families flee new Israeli assault in Gaza Khan Younis
message:

Thousands of people fled eastern Khan Younis in vehicles and on foot, belongings heaped on donkey carts and motorcycle rickshaws as they made their slow escape along congested roads.
In the latest assault, the military dropped leaflets ordering residents and displaced people sheltering in eastern Khan Younis, Gaza's main southern city, to evacuate from an area that has already seen repeated waves of fighting.

title: No charges to be filed in fatal Battle Creek shooting
message:
IDA GROVE, Iowa -- A fatal shooting in Battle Creek, Iowa, in May will not result in criminal charges being filed against the shooter.
The decision was based on the facts and circumstances of the incident and Iowa's self-defense laws, a news release from the Ida County Sheriff's Office said.
Branden Wingert, 22, of Battle Creek, shot Kevin Blume, 53, also of Battle Creek, on May 24 with a .22-caliber handgun after an altercation in the 300 block of Fifth Street.
Sheriff's deputies responding to a call of shots fired found Blume suffering from a single gunshot wound, and he was airlifted to MercyOne Siouxland Medical Center in Sioux City.
The case was investigated by the Ida County Sheriff's Office, the Iowa Division of Criminal Investigation, the Ida County Attorney's Office and the Iowa Attorney General's Office.

title: Afghan refugee breakdancer disqualified over women rights message
message:
PARIS: Refugee team member Talash has been disqualified from the Olympic breakdancing competition after making a statement for women's rights in her native Afghanistan.
The 21-year-old removed her sweater during the opening battle against Dutch b-girl India on Friday (Aug 9) to reveal a cape with the writing "Free Afghan Women."
The World DanceSport Federation later said in a statement that Talash had been disqualified for "displaying a political slogan on her attire."
Talash had previously been eliminated in the pre-qualifier battle.
Rapper Snoop Dogg was a prominent spectator, with the gold medal to be decided later on Friday.
